name: swankily
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that seems very expensive and fashionable, and is intended to attract people's attention and admiration: Located a few metres from the beach, the hotel's 160 rooms are swankily sophisticated, with designer bed linen and toiletries. His look is never showy; he dresses impeccably, but never swankily.
More examplesFewer examplesIt's only at the end of the meal that you're given the menu, swankily printed on quality paper, to commemorate the night.Last winter, I tested the swankily refurbished restaurant on the top floor of the hotel.In 1902, the under-financed Newton Heath Football Club swankily renamed itself "Manchester United".
